tools.name: get_application_status
tools.description: Provides a high-level health check of the application, including MQTT connection status, database size, and message counts.

tools.name: list_topics
tools.description: Lists all unique MQTT topics currently stored in the database. Use this to discover available data points before searching or mapping.

tools.name: get_topics_list
tools.description: Returns a flat list of all unique MQTT topics currently known, including their broker ID. Useful for disambiguating identical topics across different brokers.

tools.name: search_data
tools.description: Performs a full-text search for a keyword across all topic names and payload contents. IMPORTANT: Data is mostly in ENGLISH. Translate keywords if needed.

time_expression.description: Natural language time range (e.g., 'last 24 hours', 'since yesterday').

broker_id.description: Optional. Filter by specific broker ID.

tools.name: get_topic_history
tools.description: Get historical messages for a topic, optionally filtered by a time range.

time_expression.description: Natural language time range (e.g., 'last week', 'from 2pm to 4pm').

broker_id.description: Optional. Filter by specific broker ID.

tools.name: get_latest_message
tools.description: Retrieves the most recent message for a single, exact MQTT topic.

broker_id.description: Optional. Filter by specific broker ID.

tools.name: search_uns_concept
tools.description: Performs a precise, structured search for MQTT messages based on a known UNS concept and specific data filters.

filters.description: Key-value pairs to filter the JSON payload (e.g., {"status": "RELEASED"}).

tools.name: infer_schema
tools.description: Analyzes recent messages for a given topic pattern (e.g., 'stark_industries/security/%') and returns the inferred JSON payload schema.

tools.name: get_model_definition
tools.description: Get the definition (schema, topic template) for a concept from the UNS Model Manifest.

tools.name: update_uns_model
tools.description: Updates the content of the `uns_model.json` file. This allows adding new concepts or modifying existing schemas in the semantic model.

model_json.description: The full JSON string representing the new model array. Must be a valid JSON array of definition objects.

tools.name: publish_message
tools.description: Publish a NEW MQTT message. You MUST strictly follow the topic template and JSON schema from get_model_definition if applicable. Check 'Broker Permissions' in system prompt to choose the correct broker_id.

payload.description: The payload as a string. If format is 'json' or 'sparkplugb', this must be a valid JSON string.

broker_id.description: Optional. ID of the broker to use.

retain.description: Whether to set the retain flag.

tools.name: list_project_files
tools.description: Lists files in the project root and `data` directory. Useful for finding existing views or simulators.

tools.name: get_file_content
tools.description: Reads the content of a file (SVG, JS, JSON).

tools.name: save_file_to_data_directory
tools.description: Saves content to a file in the `data/` directory. Use for SVGs, JS bindings, or Simulators.

filename.description: The name of the file to create inside the 'data/' directory (e.g., 'my_llm_simulator.js' or 'my_animated_view.svg').

content.description: The full text content (JavaScript or SVG) to save.

tools.name: create_dynamic_view
tools.description: Creates a new interactive SVG dashboard by saving TWO files: the SVG graphic (.svg) and its logic script (.svg.js). Use this when the user asks for a 'diagram', 'synoptic', or 'view' of data. Ensure you have identified the relevant MQTT topics first.

svg_content.description: The complete XML SVG code. Must include unique IDs for dynamic elements.

js_content.description: The JavaScript code using 'window.registerSvgBindings({...})' to animate the SVG based on MQTT data.

tools.name: get_available_svg_views
tools.description: Lists all .svg files available in the /data directory that can be displayed in the 'SVG View' tab.

tools.name: get_mapper_config
tools.description: Retrieves the entire (JSON) configuration for the Topic Mapper engine, including all versions and rules.

tools.name: update_mapper_rule
tools.description: Adds or updates a mapping rule in the active configuration. WARNING: The code runs in a sandbox. You MUST act on `msg` (input) and return `msg` (output).

sourceTopic.description: The exact source topic to match (e.g., 'stark_industries/malibu_facility/mes/oee').

targetTopic.description: The destination topic to publish to (e.g., 'UNS/malibu/kpi/oee_percent').

targetCode.description: The ASYNC JavaScript code for the transformation. Must return the `msg` object.

tools.name: prune_topic_history
tools.description: Deletes messages from the database that match a specific topic pattern. Can be filtered by broker_id.

topic_pattern.description: The topic pattern to prune, using MQTT wildcards (+, #).

broker_id.description: Optional. The ID of the broker to prune from (e.g., 'broker_1').

tools.name: get_simulator_status
tools.description: Gets the current status of all available simulators (e.g., 'stark_industries', 'death_star').

tools.name: start_simulator
tools.description: Starts a specific MQTT data simulator by name.

name.description: The name of the scenario to start (e.g., 'stark_industries').

tools.name: stop_simulator
tools.description: Stops a specific MQTT data simulator by name.

name.description: The name of the scenario to stop.

tools.name: restart_application_server
tools.description: Triggers a graceful restart of the main MQTT UNS Viewer web server.

tools.name: list_alert_rules
tools.description: Lists all defined alert rules. Includes rule ID, name, severity, and status.

tools.name: list_active_alerts
tools.description: Lists currently triggered alerts. Includes timestamp, severity, status (new, acknowledged, etc.) and analysis.

tools.name: create_alert_rule
tools.description: Creates a new detection rule. condition_code is JS returning boolean (e.g., `return msg.payload.value > 50`).

condition_code.description: JavaScript condition. Access `msg.payload`. Must return boolean.

workflow_prompt.description: Optional instructions for AI Agent when alert triggers.

is_global.description: If true, creates a global rule (Admin only).

tools.name: update_alert_rule
tools.description: Updates an existing alert rule.

id.description: The ID of the rule to update.

tools.name: delete_alert_rule
tools.description: Deletes an alert rule.

id.description: The ID of the rule to delete.

tools.name: update_alert_status
tools.description: Updates the status of a triggered alert (e.g., acknowledge it).

alert_id.description: The ID of the alert instance.
